metadata.title: YouTube Channel Audit 2025: How to Analyze Your Channel
metadata.description: Conduct a YouTube channel audit. Identify strengths, weaknesses, and growth opportunities.

hero.headline: YouTube Channel Audit Guide
hero.subheadline: Systematic channel review. Find what's working and what needs fixing.

sections.content: A channel audit is a systematic review of your YouTube presence—identifying what's working, what's not, and where opportunities exist. Regular audits prevent stagnation and reveal blind spots. Here's how to conduct a thorough self-audit.

content.title: Performance Metrics
content.description: Views, watch time, subscriber growth. Trends over time.

content.title: Visual Branding
content.description: Thumbnails, banner, consistency. First impressions matter.

content.title: Content Strategy
content.description: Topics, formats, posting frequency. What's working?

content.title: Growth Rate
content.description: Subscribers per month. Is growth accelerating or declining?

content.title: Average CTR
content.description: Thumbnail effectiveness. Compare to your own average.

content.title: Average View Duration
content.description: Content quality signal. Benchmark against video length.

content.title: Traffic Sources
content.description: Where views come from. Search vs browse vs external.

sections.title: What to Look For
content: Where do viewers typically drop off?

faq.question: How often should I audit my channel?
faq.answer: Full audit quarterly. Monthly check on key metrics. Don't over-analyze—focus on patterns, not daily fluctuations.

faq.question: What's most important in an audit?
faq.answer: Finding what differentiates your hits from misses. The patterns in your own data are more valuable than generic advice.

faq.question: Should I hire someone for an audit?
faq.answer: Self-audits are valuable and free. Professional audits can catch blind spots. Worth it if budget allows and you've plateaued.

faq.question: What tools help with audits?
faq.answer: YouTube Studio Analytics is primary. VidIQ/TubeBuddy for competitor analysis. Spreadsheet for tracking patterns over time.
